item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Skirk and Dahlia Changes for Version 5.7
item.description:
Recent datamining from the Genshin Impact beta has revealed a few notable changes for Skirk and Dahlia, as Version 5.7 eyes its release on June 18, 2025. One thing that has come to define Genshin Impact in the Natlan era is how quiet its beta cycles have been. Whereas Fontaine characters were often subjected to a lot of changes during beta, the developers seem to have more confidence in the Natlan cast overall.

A perfect example of this happens to be Escoffier, the new Genshin Impact character released in Version 5.6. While an argument could be made that Escoffier is an inelegant solution to fixing Freeze teams as a whole, the 5-Star Cryo Polearm has managed to revitalize a lot of old units like Ganyu and Ayaka, dragging them back to the meta for the first time since Sumeru. Skirk and Dahlia are extensions of Escoffier in a way, as both characters will be tied to Freeze â€“ albeit in very different roles.

While Skirk has been positively received over her ability kit, player impressions of Dahlia in Genshin Impact range from mildly disappointing to outright negative. According to HomDGCat, it would seem that HoYoverse is attempting to address some of Dahlia's key issues by increasing his shield strength. The latest changes have also improved Dahlia's attack speed buff, making him better than Mika at C6. As for Skirk, the base multipliers for her Elemental Burst have been nerfed, but her Serpent's Subtlety stacks have been buffed, resulting in an overall damage increase.

Genshin Impact: Skirk and Dahlia Changes in Version 5.7 (v3)

Dahlia

  • Elemental Burst
    • Skill DMG: 731.52%;
    • Shield of Sacred Favor DMG Absorption: 6.048% (up from 5.04%) Max HP + 711.8809 (up from 593.23413);
    • Favonian Favor Duration: 12s;
    • Energy Cost: 60;
    • CD: 15s;

  • Passive Talent
    • When your active party member is affected by the Favonian Favor effect of the Elemental Burst, their ATK SPD will increase based on Dahlia's Max HP: Every 1,000 Max HP will cause an increase of 0.5% (up from 0.4%), up to a maximum of 20% (up from 15%).

Skirk

  • Elemental Burst
    • Skill DMG: 220.968% (down from 248.616%);
    • Skill Final Attack DMG: 368.28% (down from 414.36%);
    • Serpent's Subtlety Bonus: 34.782% (up from 29.9261%) ATK Per Point;
    • 0/1/2/3 Void Rift Absorption DMG Bonus: 8.0%/12.0%/16.0%/20.0%;
    • CD: 15s;

While the changes to Dahlia are welcome, players feel like more could be done to make the 4-Star Hydro Sword worthwhile. As things are, Dahlia may find some value in Skirk teams, but will otherwise be eclipsed by other Support characters in Genshin Impact . On the other hand, Skirk will likely be a great Freeze hypercarry, offering a modern alternative to Ayaka and Ganyu. She won't be the most powerful character in the game, as HoYoverse will continue to carefully tread the line of powercreep.

It remains to be seen how the roster will evolve in Nod-Krai. Natlan characters introduced Nightsoul to the equation, and all signs point that Version 6.0 will feature a new combat mechanic. There are rumors that Version 5.8 will debut a Hydro 5-Star to Genshin Impact , but very little is known about the next region and its characters. Version 5.7 is set to launch on June 18, 2025, while Version 6.0 will open its doors to the Traveler on September 10, 2025.

item.title: Nintendo is Going to Be at Gamescom
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo will attend Gamescom 2025 in Cologne from August 20 to 24.
  • The company was absent from the 2024 event.
  • It's unclear what Nintendo will show during the trade fair, but fans are eager to hear release dates for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and Pokemon Legends: Z-A.

Nintendo has confirmed it will return to the annual Gamescom video game trade fair in Cologne, Germany, after missing the 2024 show. Although Nintendo did not state what projects it would show at Gamescom 2025, the gaming giant said it would be on the Koelnmesse show floor during the main part of the event.

Held annually in August since its foundation in 2009, Gamescom is Europe's largest gaming trade show. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, Gamescom has since succeeded E3 as the largest expo of its kind in the West. The event is held at the Koelnmesse, or Cologne Trade Fair grounds, located on the banks of the Rhine. Due to its outstanding growth, Gamescom has grown to incorporate two other shows, including the upcoming Gamescom Asia in Thailand and the recently held Gamescom LATAM in Brazil. Gamescom Opening Night Live's 2024 broadcast was headlined by titles such as Borderlands 4 and Mafia: The Old Country .

Although a precise list of game developers that will attend Gamescom 2025 remains elusive, Nintendo has already stated its intent to attend the annual trade show. On Nintendo's German-language social media feeds (and corroborated by MyNintendoNews), the company confirmed that it will attend Gamescom 2025 from August 20 to 24. After missing last year's show, Nintendo asked fans to mark their calendars in red and said it looked forward to welcoming fans to Cologne for the annual gaming trade show.

Nintendo Will Be at Gamescom 2025 in Cologne This August

  • Nintendo will attend Gamescom 2025 in Cologne, Germany.
  • The trade fair will be open to attendees from August 20 to 24.
  • Gamescom is the largest European gaming trade show and has grown significantly.
  • Nintendo's Gamescom appearance will happen two months after the Switch 2's June 5 launch.

However, Nintendo did not state what it would show at Gamescom 2025 as of this writing. Given that Gamescom 2025 will happen in the latter half of August, Nintendo's appearance will take place two months after the Switch 2 console hits store shelves on June 5. A few Switch 2 games, such as Mario Kart World and Donkey Kong Bananza , will likely make appearances on the showroom floor for Gamescom attendees to try out.

It is worth noting that two of Nintendo's biggest 2025 first-party releases, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and Pokemon Legends: Z-A , do not currently have precise release dates. Whether those two titles will have more information revealed during Gamescom Opening Night Live or June's Summer Game Fest remains to be seen. Both the Summer Game Fest and Gamescom Opening Night Live broadcasts are hosted by Geoff Keighley.

With over 335,000 attendees at last year's show, and plans to continue expanding the Gamescom brand across the globe, the Cologne-based trade fair shows no signs of slowing down. Only time will tell what Nintendo will reveal at the Koelnmesse this summer.

item.title: Ghost Recon Fans Need to Keep an Eye on June 6
item.description:
Summary

  • Ubisoft may reveal the next Ghost Recon installment at Summer Game Fest, shifting away from past Forward showcases.
  • Industry insider Detective Seeds hints at the next game being far in development, suggesting an announcement in the near future.
  • Ubisoft's rumored decision to avoid a Forward presentation may be due to a lack of upcoming titles, making SGF the best host for a potential game reveal.

An industry insider believes Ubisoft could show up to the live Summer Game Fest showcase with the reveal of the next Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon installment. Once one of Ubisoft's premier game series throughout the 2000s and early 2010s, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon has taken somewhat of a backseat since 2019's Breakpoint disappointed. Ubisoft did formally announce a free-to-play PvP live service Ghost Recon game known as Frontlines in 2021 before it was canceled months later.

Summer Game Fest is right around the corner and, as usual, there's a ton to be excited about. There are currently three events locked in with more to be confirmed in the coming days and weeks leading up to the kickoff on June 6. Geoff Keighley's own Summer Game Fest showcase will get the ball rolling and will be immediately followed by Day of the Devs, the annual indie showcase led by Double Fine Productions' Tim Schafer. Xbox is set to follow two days later on June 8 and is looking to have another mind-blowing event just like its show last June. This time, Obsidian Entertainment's second major 2025 RPG, The Outer Worlds 2, will have its own 30-minute Direct once Xbox's showcase concludes.

It seems Ubisoft's Summer Game Fest plans might be looking a bit different than they have in the past few years. On Twitter, industry insider Detective Seeds has expressed uncertainty about Ubisoft holding its own live Ubisoft Forward showcase this year, going further to say that the French gaming giant could unveil the next Ghost Recon game on Geoff Keighley's SGF stage instead. Whether Seeds is referring to a resurrection of Ghost Recon: Frontlines or an entirely new non-PvP title isn't exactly clear, but they mention that the game is deep in development.

New Ghost Recon Game Could Be Revealed at Summer Game Fest Showcase

Ubisoft seems to be in a strange spot at the moment. With its heaviest hitters in Star Wars Outlaws and Assassin's Creed Shadows already having been released and no sign of the Splinter Cell, Assassin's Creed 4, or Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remakes, Ubisoft might not have enough titles that are set to release within the next year to warrant having an entire Ubisoft Forward showcase this summer. Holding a live event to announce one major new game wouldn't be a good idea, so dishing out the potential Ghost Recon reveal to Keighley's SGF stage would make more sense. When asked about the heavily rumored Far Cry 7 , Detective Seeds didn't have much to share, indicating the open-world FPS might not be ready to be shown just yet, bolstering Ubisoft's rumored decision to not hold a Forward.

Whether Detective Seeds turns out to be right will remain to be seen, as it's entirely possible Ubisoft still has a Forward showcase lined up with a number of the aforementioned titles ready to finally be shown off. Summer Game Fest begins on June 6, with the SGF showcase kicking off at 5 PM Eastern Time. If Ubisoft does confirm a Ubi Forward, it'll likely take place the day after Xbox's showcase, as has been standard for Summer Game Fest's schedule in prior years.

item.title: Better Call Saul Actor Officially Joins Naughty Dog's Intergalactic
item.description:
Summary

  • Tony Dalton of Better Call Saul and Hawkeye fame is officially confirmed as a cast member for Naughty Dog's upcoming Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet.
  • Dalton most recently made an appearance in The Last of Us Season 2, Episode 6, and his performance prompted Naughty Dog boss Neil Druckmann to offer him the Intergalactic role.
  • Other Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet actors include Tati Gabrielle, Kumail Nanjiani, Stephen A. Chang, Troy Baker, and Halley Gross.

Naughty Dog has confirmed that a well-regarded Better Call Saul actor will be part of the cast of the studio's next game: Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet . The inclusion of this actor in Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet isn't exactly a brand-new development, but it's the first time Naughty Dog has acknowledged it, alongside shedding some light on the casting decision.

MILD SPOILERS for The Last of Us Season 2, Episode 6 ahead Revealed at The Game Awards 2024 last December, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is an upcoming original franchise from Naughty Dog that veers quite far from the studio's prior work. The impressive in-engine announcement trailer for Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet showed off an all-new sci-fi setting in an alternate timeline where space travel made huge leaps in the 1980s, replete with numerous real-world references. Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet 's trailer also featured bounty-hunting protagonist Jordan A. Mun - played by Tati Gabrielle - and teased a few other popular actors as part of the game's cast list.

Among these actors was Tony Dalton , best known for his roles as Lalo Salamanca in Better Call Saul and Jack Duquesne in Hawkeye . Dalton recently appeared in Episode 6 of The Last of Us Season 2 , portraying Joel's father - Javier Miller - in a series of emotionally weighted flashbacks. In a new interview with Entertainment Weekly, Naughty Dog boss Neil Druckmann revealed that he was moved by Dalton's performance and didn't hesitate to extend an invitation to join Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet . "He immediately came to mind, and I just offered it to him on the spot," said Druckmann in reference to Dalton's role in the game.

Every Known Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet Cast Member So Far

  • Halley Gross (AJ)
  • Kumail Nanjiani (Colin Graves)
  • Stephen A. Chang (role unconfirmed)
  • Tati Gabrielle (Jordan A. Mun)
  • Tony Dalton (role unconfirmed)
  • Troy Baker (role unconfirmed)

Dalton joins Tati Gabrielle, Halley Gross, Stephen A. Chang, and Troy Baker as officially confirmed cast members for Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet . Aside from them, Kumail Nanjiani will also be part of the game as a character named Colin Graves, but a formal announcement about this has yet to come from him or Naughty Dog. Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet 's trailer hinted at the characters of Dalton, Chang, Nanjiani, and Gabrielle being members of a group dubbed the "Five Aces." However, something clearly goes wrong between them as Jordan is shown to be pursuing Colin as a bounty at the end of the trailer.

The reasons behind the Five Aces' fallout, Jordan's motives to hunt Colin, and Dalton's role in Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet expectedly remain under wraps for now, but Naughty Dog fans are quite excited about the high-caliber talent in the game. It remains to be seen when Naughty Dog plans to release more information about Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet , with gameplay footage being one of the most popular requests. Thankfully, Druckmann has stated that the game is already playable at Naughty Dog, but reputable insider Jason Schreier delivered a less encouraging update a few months ago, claiming that Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet won't launch before 2027.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Game Cases Seem to Be a Downgrade
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo Switch 2 game cases are now solid red.
  • Switch 1 cases were transparent, which allowed the double-sided art to show on the inside.
  • This change may disappoint some fans.

The Nintendo Switch 2 is shaking things up with its game cases, seemingly ditching the artwork that was previously featured on the inside. In addition to those potential changes, the Switch 2's cases are also solid red this time around, a notable departure from the original Switch's classic clear cases. This will likely help the Nintendo Switch 2's catalog stand out in physical stores, ensuring fans pick the right game for the right console, but may disappoint hardcore collectors.

It's now just a few weeks before Nintendo officially releases its Switch 2 console, which comes equipped with all kinds of upgrades and updates over the previous model. Now, in addition to the console's updated design, the Switch 2 is also seemingly changing the way its game cases look.

According to Genki_JPN, the game cases for the Switch 2 feature a new, all-red design. While the cases themselves are the same size, the colors are completely different, with the Switch 2 versions sporting a new bright red design. In addition, Genki_JPN also showed that the inside of the case does not have any artwork. Previously, physical releases for the original Switch included double-sided art, which showed through thanks to the Switch 1's transparent cases, but the Switch 2 cases appear not to have anything on the inside. However, there are still a lot of unknown details regarding the Switch 2 and its games, so this could change.

Nintendo Switch 2 Game Cases May Not Feature Inside Artwork

It appears Nintendo will be heading in a different direction when it comes to the physical copies of games for the Switch 2, though things are always subject to change. Other games for Switch 2 may still feature artwork inside the cases, even if Mario Kart World does not. Players will simply have to wait and see what exactly is in store for the Switch 2 and its list of games when the console releases on June 5.

Not only will the Switch 2 be able to play demanding games like Cyberpunk 2077 , but it will also feature a larger screen. Joy-Cons have also been redesigned for the Switch 2, this time clicking into place with magnets rather than sliding. These new Joy-Cons can also be used as mice, opening the door for cool new features and gameplay tools in future games. Pre-orders for the console sold out fast, meaning it may be difficult to find a Nintendo Switch 2 even after it officially releases on June 5, 2025.
